description: Parameter descriptors for business relationship queries with relationship type disambiguation

parameters.description: List of company identifiers to find companies with specific business relationships. Always batch multiple identifiers when possible.
common_mistakes: Making separate API calls for each company instead of batching
Not using array format for single identifiers
Expecting financial data (this tool only provides relationship information)

parameters.description: The type of business relationship to search for. Must match exact relationship types from the system.

examples.borrower: Companies that have borrowed money or received financing
examples.supplier: Companies that provide goods or services to the queried company
examples.customer: Companies that purchase goods or services from the queried company
examples.lender: Companies that have provided loans or financing to others
examples.partner: Companies with strategic partnerships or joint ventures
examples.distributor: Companies that distribute or resell the queried company's products
examples.vendor: Companies that provide supplies, services, or components
examples.client: Companies that are clients or customers for professional services

common_mistakes: Using plural forms like 'suppliers' instead of 'supplier'
Using generic terms like 'business_partner' instead of 'partner'
Not using exact relationship type names from the system
Using synonyms instead of exact parameter values
